definition: to associate with/to keep company with
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
surname Wu
squad of five soldiers/to associate with/five (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

sentences.english: Some of you are bound to have met with disappointment in the recruiting season.
sentences.chinese: 在招聘季节中，你们当中有的人注定要与失望为伍。

sentences.english: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll fall among the stars.
sentences.chinese: 以月亮为的，即便错过，也会与群星为伍。

sentences.english: He preferred living freely wth rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 他宁愿自由自在地与垃圾为伍。

sentences.english: Associating with people like Li Mei-t'ing and Ku Er-chien was such a shameful debasement .
sentences.chinese: 与李梅亭顾尔谦等为伍，就是可耻的堕落。

sentences.english: Associating with stupid is not necessarily stupid, it may be a dreamer.
sentences.chinese: 与笨人为伍的不一定是笨人，也可能是梦想家。

sentences.english: You are the sum of the people you spend the most time with.
sentences.chinese: 你要将大部分的时间都花在与这类人在为伍。

sentences.english: After this, you may stay with the nature of Tao, roaming in the broad realm of perfect freedom.
sentences.chinese: 从此与自然之道为伍，遨游于开阔的大莫之国中。

sentences.english: I do not want to be one of the swines in your entourage.
sentences.chinese: 我不想与您的随员中那些卑劣的家伙们为伍。

sentences.english: We shouldn’t join them, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们无需与他们为伍。

sentences.english: To deny love is to align ourselves with a cold, uncaring world.
sentences.chinese: 我们若没有爱，就是与冷酷而无情的世界为伍了。

sentences.english: And 92-year-old Sun Jiaxiang also is involved in stories.
sentences.chinese: 今年92岁的孙家香老太，也与故事为伍。

sentences.english: So at least he had a kind of companionship.
sentences.chinese: 现在他至少有一种伙伴为伍了。

definition: to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others
to set oneself against/to oppose/to make a pair
all day long
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
to make a living/to strive to earn a living
to disdain/to loathe
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
mediocre person
to feel contented with
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
vulgar/coarse/uncouth
lowly/despicable/to despise
lit. persons who walk different paths cannot make plans together/to go separate ways (idiom)
pinyin: dao4 bu4 tong2 bu4 xiang1 wei2 mou2

definition: to drift through life
